name: Anthropic Claude Opus 4.6
description: Latest AI model launched February 5, 2026 with enhanced coding capabilities, a million-token context window, and improved sustained agentic task performance for longer coding sessions.
community_quotes: Claude Opus 4.6 improves on its predecessor's coding skills
Plans more carefully and sustains agentic tasks for longer
Million-token context window for complex projects

name: OpenAI GPT-5.3-Codex
description: Launched February 5, 2026 as an expansion of Codex across the full spectrum of professional computer work, with enhanced agentic coding capabilities and broader application scope.
community_quotes: Expanding Codex across the full spectrum of professional work on a computer
New agentic coding model with enhanced capabilities
Direct competition to Anthropic's Claude Opus 4.6

name: GitHub Copilot Claude & Codex Integration
description: GitHub announced on February 4, 2026 that Claude by Anthropic and OpenAI Codex are now available in public preview as coding agents for Copilot Pro+ and Copilot Enterprise customers.
community_quotes: Claude and Codex now available in public preview on GitHub
Multi-agent AI coding inside repositories
Repository-aware AI agents from major providers

name: Kilo CLI 1.0
description: An open-source, model-agnostic command-line interface for terminal-native AI coding with support for 500+ AI models, built on OpenCode foundation and designed for 2026 as the year of agent adoption.
community_quotes: Kilo CLI 1.0 brings open-source vibe coding to your terminal with support for 500+ AI models
If 2025 was the year senior engineers stopped rolling their eyes at AI coding, 2026 is the year
Terminal-native agentic engineering

name: OpenAI Codex App
description: A native macOS desktop application launched February 2, 2026 that serves as an 'agent command center' for AI coding, enabling developers to run multiple AI agents with parallel workflows.
community_quotes: OpenAI launches Codex app to gain ground in AI coding race
An agent command center for AI coding
Positions OpenAI to compete directly with Claude Code and Cursor

name: Devlop AI
description: An AI IDE specifically designed for embedded systems development that writes and flashes STM32 firmware for development boards, launched on Product Hunt in February 2026.
community_quotes: An AI IDE that writes and flashes STM32 firmware
Specialized for embedded systems development

name: OpenClaw
description: A privacy-first personal AI assistant announced February 1, 2026 as part of Ollama v0.15.4, connecting messaging apps to local AI coding agents with over 140K GitHub stars within 2 weeks of launch.
community_quotes: Privacy-first AI agent solution running on your own device
150K+ GitHub stars within 2 weeks - one of the fastest-growing open source projects
Bridges messaging platforms to local AI coding agents

name: Mistral Vibe 2.0
description: A terminal-based AI coding agent powered by Devstral 2 that became generally available in late January 2026, shifting from beta to full release for command-line AI development workflows.
community_quotes: Terminal-based AI coding agent
Generally available as of late January 2026
Designed for CLI-first development workflows

name: OpenAI Prism
description: Launched January 27, 2026 as a free, LaTeX-native workspace for scientists and researchers, described as a Claude Code-like application for scientific computing and research paper development.
community_quotes: OpenAI's latest product lets you vibe code science
A free AI workspace for scientists in LaTeX
Claude Code-like app for scientific research
